critique: This document pertains to the regulation of the distilled spirits industry under the National Industrial Recovery Act. Given the context of the 1930s and the New Deal era, the document reflects a moderate level of government intervention in the economy. There is no direct indication of ideological tilt, immigration policy, executive power expansion, federalism implications, national security concerns, or social inclusion matters. Therefore, most axes should be scored as neutral, with a slight lean towards government intervention in economic regulation.
